result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth A Bowen was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at a future hearing.
01/27/2017 PER HEARING RESTITUTION SET TO ZERO.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept.   Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
01/27/17 CASH BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS, PAID IN FULL.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
ATTEND a Victim Impact Panel Meeting. during probation.

Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
01/27/17 CASH BAIL APPLIED TO FINE, BALANCE TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OR PROBATION.

Work toward / Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Comply with any Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kenneth A Bowen in court with Attorney Michael A Verrilli.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters an alford no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.   Counts #2, 4 & 5 are dismissed and read-in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Verrilli makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following. 

COUNT #1:

The Defendant was given the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
Prescribed;
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____ Work toward/Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling :
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____Attend a Victim Impact Panel during Probation

DL REVOCATION: 36 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months

RESTITUTION:  Hearing to be set.

FINE:  $1519.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation). Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Brookfield Police Dept.  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 120 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Sentence to commence forthwith. 44 days of credit granted against condition time. 

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
